strategy:
Use CatBoost with these settings: iterations=600, learning_rate=0.025, depth=6. For preprocessing: fill numeric NaN with the median, drop columns with >50% missing values. Do NOT use get_dummies for categorical columns — instead, pass the cat_features parameter to CatBoost. If you encounter a dtype error, cast categorical columns to strings before passing them to the model.

(VS suggestion: Use CatBoost with iterations=500, learning_rate=0.03, depth=6. For preprocessing: fill numeric NaN with median, drop columns with >50% missingness, and apply robust scaling (RobustScaler) to numeric features instead of standardization. This reduces sensitivity to outliers and may stabilize training in noisy data distributions, potentially improving generalization. Do not use get_dummies; pass cat_features as before. If dtype errors occur, cast categorical columns to strings first.)
